page.title: 09Trade - Mr. Taylor
page.content: Mr Taylor has lived in Wickham Market since 1920 and has been a shopkeeper since he left school. Dealing mainly in foodstuffs he has sold milk, groceries and even secondhand furniture. His shop on the hill used to have a long counter behind which he served his customers. In those days things like sugar band flour were scooped out of a sack or barrel and put into brown paper bags before being sold. Now everything is in packets and lies on the shelves for the customers to help themselves. Nowadays he sells such things as frogs legs and snails, wines, spirits, many different cheeses as well as normal groceries. Many years ago Mr Taylor had to go round to his customers houses with an order book and the next day deliver on his bike. Competition was strong, there were less people and more shops in Wickham. Most people shopped in Wickham
